summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Board of Adjustment (Panel C) of the City of Dallas will convene on February 22, 2024, for a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place at Dallas City Hall, Room 6ES, with an option for videoconference participation. The purpose of the meeting is to address various zoning and adjustment requests from residents.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, public testimony, and the approval of previous meeting minutes. The primary focus will be on the case docket, which includes uncontested items, holdover cases, and individual cases requiring decisions.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals under consideration include requests for variances and special exceptions related to fence height, front-yard setbacks, and single-family use regulations. Specific cases include applications from Ludovic Gombos for a fence height exception at 3321 Coronet Boulevard and from Blanca Cardenas for a front-yard setback variance at 4859 Corrigan Drive.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is seeking approval for the minutes from the December 11, 2023, meeting and will deliberate on multiple individual cases, including variances and special exceptions. Decisions will be made on the presented applications, impacting zoning regulations and property use in the Dallas area. Public participation is encouraged, with registration required for those wishing to speak.
